title: Ear Care in Ayurveda: Safe Practices and Remedies
author: Harish
excerpt: Ayurvedic ear care emphasizes gentle oiling, massage, and safety. Learn when to use ear oils and when to see a doctor.
content:
Traditional Ear Care Basics

Ayurveda values gentle ear rituals like Karna Purana—warming oil applied around the ear for relaxation and mild support. However, safety is paramount: do not instill oils into the ear canal without professional guidance.

When to Use Herbal Ear Oils

  • For evening relaxation and mild ear discomfort (external).
  • To soothe the surrounding skin after sun exposure or wind exposure.
  • As part of a calming head-and-neck oiling ritual.

When to Seek Medical Care

If you experience ear discharge, sharp pain, fever, sudden changes in hearing, or suspected perforation—seek ENT care immediately. These are not situations for at-home oil instillation.

How to Use Safely

  1. Warm oil in a water bath—test on wrist.
  2. Apply externally around the ear and massage gently for 1–2 minutes.
  3. Wipe away excess oil; do not insert objects into the ear canal.
